Award.AwardTitle: Midwest Several Complex Variables Conference at Syracuse University
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding for US participation in the conference "Midwest Several Complex Variables Conference" that will be held May 18-20, 2018 at Syracuse University.

The conference focuses on recent developments in Analysis, especially in the fields of Several Complex Variables. A number of distinguished mathematicians have agreed to attend and speak at this conference. This award gives early career researchers, members of underrepresented groups, researchers not funded by NSF and the like an opportunity to attend and participate in this conference. The organizing committee will strive to make this funding opportunity known to target groups through a number of different activities. More information will be made available at:

sites.google.com/sites/SyrMidSCV2018

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Midwest Several Complex Variables Conferences go back to the 1980's. They continue to provide a unique opportunity for senior and junior researchers to interact and initiate joint projects. This conference award was used to support in part the 2018 Midwest Several Complex Variables Conference held at Syracuse University during May 18-20, 2018. The conference website is:

https://sites.google.com/view/syrmidscv2018/home

The main accomplishment was to organize and host a mathematics conference that brought together the several complex variables community in the US, as well as participants from Canada, France, Iceland, Norway, Turkey. The NSF support was targeted primarily to the junior participants, since senior speakers and participants were also supported by funds from Syracuse University. There were in total 72 registered participants (listed on the conference website), and 50% of them were junior mathematicians or graduate students.  

The main outcomes of the conference include 12 one-hour lectures and 6 half-hour lectures. Speakers, titles and conference program are listed on the conference website. The abstracts of all talks, as well as lecture notes for 11 talks, are available there as well. Many of the talks will undoubtedly be published as research papers in professional journals. The conference offered a platform for the several complex variables community in the US, and primarily for the junior members of this community, to showcase their latest research accomplishments and receive feedback from the senior participants, through dedicated time for discussions.


Last Modified: 02/01/2019
Modified by: Dan Coman
